newsitem.title: UK: Citibank appoints UK ad agency for Euro-campaign.
newsitem.headline: Citibank appoints UK ad agency for Euro-campaign.

text.p: Citibank, the world's largest issuer of credit cards, has appointed the British advertising network, Lowe Group, to mastermind an advertising campaign for 'Citibank Credit Cards' across Europe, Lowe said on Friday.
The move marks the U.S. bank's first foray in pan-European advertising. Lowe & Partners/SMS in New York has handled Citibank's credit card business since 1980, it said.
Brussels-based Lowe Troost -- sharing the same location as Citibank's European headquarters -- will create and coordinate all advertising activity for the bank.
A multi-media campaign will break in Spain later this year before being rolled out in other key European markets in 1997.

"We want to achieve the same levels of success in Europe as we have in the States, with a campaign idea that addresses the unique European issues," Charles Del Porto, business manager for Citibank Cards - Europe, said in a statement.
No details of the size of the investment were disclosed.
